Dec 18 - Brighton - Sussex Arts Club 7 Ship Street tickets £10 / show starts at 8:00pm Dec 19 - Winchester - The Railway 3 St Pauls Hill tickets £10 / show starts at 8:00pm THU 1/18/2007 New York NY - Tonic FRI 1/19/2007 Brooklyn NY - Union Hall SAT 1/20/2007 New York NY - Winter Garden The American Beauty Project - free show SUN 1/21/2007 New York NY - Winter Garden The American Beauty Project - free show MON 1/22/2007 Boston MA - Middle East Upstairs TUE 1/23/2007 Northampton MA - Iron Horse WED 1/24/2007 Philadelphia PA - Northstar Bar THU 1/25/2007 Arlington VA - Iota
Eitzel to perform at The American Beauty Project

The American Beauty Project will honor the Grateful Dead’s Dead’s two storied 1970 albums, American Beauty and Workingman’s Dead -- albums comprised of true hymns to Americana, and created during a period in the band's history that they were compared to a Charles Ives village green band -- with two free concerts under the glass atrium of the World Financial Center Winter Garden (directly across the street from the World Trade Center site in lower Manhattan), Saturday and Sunday, January 20 and 21, 2007. Performing their own arrangements of the songs will be Mark Eitzel (American Music Club), Tim O’Reagan (The Jayhawks), Catherine Russell, The Holmes Brothers, Ollabelle, Jay Farrar (Son Volt/Uncle Tupelo), Jorma Kaukonen (Jefferson Airplane/Hot Tuna), Toshi Reagon, Dar Williams, Jim Lauderdale, Jen Chapin, Larry Campbell (Bob Dylan, Phil Lesh & Friends), Andy Statman, The Klezmatics, Tony Trischka, and many more! The American Beauty Project links: www.myspace.com/americanbeautyproject www.worldfinancialcenter.com Workingman's Dead - Saturday, January 20, 2007 American Beauty - Sunday, January 21, 2007 Both nights start at 8:00pm Winter Garden at World Financial Center 220 Vesey Street, bordered by West Street, Liberty Street & the Hudson River Lower Manhattan / New York City Info: (212) 417-7000
Mark Eitzel's most recent solo album, Candy Ass, is available now. BUY IT NOW
Mark Eitzel Demo Before Love Songs

Mark has released a collection of demos and acoustic versions of songs that ended up on AMC's Love Songs For Patriots. The CDs is called "Demos Before Love Songs." Most of these tracks were recorded in Chicago with Jay Bennett (former Wilco) before AMC got back together. BUY IT NOW
